perturbation.original_text: During the term of this Agreement and for a period of seven (7) years after its termination or expiration each Party (the “Receiving Party”) shall maintain in confidence and, except as authorized by this Agreement, not use any know-how, data, processes, techniques, formulas, test data and other information disclosed by the other Party (the “Disclosing Party”) and which for any of the foregoing, if written, is marked “Confidential” by the Disclosing Party or, if verbal or visual, is identified in writing as “Confidential” at the time of disclosure and reduced to writing by the Disclosing Party within thirty (30) days of the verbal or visual disclosure (“Confidential Information”).
perturbation.changed_text: During the term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year after its termination or expiration each Party (the “Receiving Party”) shall maintain in confidence and, except as authorized by this Agreement, not use any know-how, data, processes, techniques, formulas, test data and other information disclosed by the other Party (the “Disclosing Party”) and which for any of the foregoing, if written, is marked “Confidential” by the Disclosing Party or, if verbal or visual, is identified in writing as “Confidential” at the time of disclosure and reduced to writing by the Disclosing Party within ninety (90) days of the verbal or visual disclosure (“Confidential Information”).
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the confidentiality period from seven years to one year, which may be considered unreasonably short for protecting sensitive business information, especially trade secrets.  Additionally, the timeframe to reduce verbal disclosures to writing is extended from 30 to 90 days, conflicting with the need for prompt confidentiality management.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secrets Law, potentially creating insufficient protection under common law principles of confidentiality.

perturbation.original_text:
ArTara, Affiliates, and sublicensees will obtain and maintain commercial general liability insurance with a reputable and financially secure insurance carrier prior to clinical testing, making, using, importing, offering to sell, or selling any licensed Product or engaging in any other act involving any licensed Product or the patent rights, if such act could possibly create risk of a claim against University Indemnitees for personal injury or property damage.
(a) The insurance will identify University Indemnitees as additional insureds and will provide that the carrier will notify University in writing at least […***…] prior to cancellation, non-renewal, or material change in coverage. Should ArTara fail to obtain replacement insurance providing comparable coverage within such […***…] period, University will have the right to termination this Agreement effective as of the end of the […***…] period without notice or any additional cure period.
perturbation.changed_text: ArTara, Affiliates, and sublicensees will obtain commercial general liability insurance prior to clinical testing. The insurance will identify University Indemnitees as additional insureds and will provide that the carrier will notify University in writing at least ten (10) days prior to cancellation, non-renewal, or material change in coverage. Should ArTara fail to obtain replacement insurance providing comparable coverage within such ten (10) day period, University will have the right to termination this Agreement effective as of the end of the ten (10) day period without notice or any additional cure period.
perturbation.explanation: The insurance notification period is reduced to 10 days. Many states require insurance companies to provide a minimum of 30 days' notice for cancellation or non-renewal of insurance policies. Reducing the notification period makes it more difficult for the University to secure replacement coverage in time, potentially leading to a lapse in coverage and violating insurance regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State insurance regulations regarding cancellation/non-renewal notice periods.

perturbation.original_text: University and/or Principal Investigator shall provide ArTara with a copy of any proposed Publication for review and comment at least […***…] prior to submission thereof for publication. ArTara shall have […***…], after receipt of said copy to object to such proposed Publication because there is Confidential Information which needs protection. In the event that ArTara makes such objection, University and/or Principal Investigator shall refrain from submitting such Publication for a maximum of […***…] from date of receipt of such objection in order for ArTara to file patent application(s) directed to patentable subject matter contained in the proposed Publication. If in its review, ArTara identifies information it considers to be its Confidential Information, ArTara may require redaction of that Confidential Information; provided, however, that ArTara shall not require removal of information necessary for complete and accurate presentation and interpretation of the Program Data and results. The Publication shall occur within […***…] of the date the Project is closed or terminated, or University and/or Principal Investigator shall be free to publish Program Data and results at that time.
perturbation.changed_text: University and/or Principal Investigator shall provide ArTara with a copy of any proposed Publication for review and comment at least five (5) days prior to submission thereof for publication. ArTara shall have two (2) days, after receipt of said copy to object to such proposed Publication because there is Confidential Information which needs protection. In the event that ArTara makes such objection, University and/or Principal Investigator shall refrain from submitting such Publication for a maximum of five (5) days from date of receipt of such objection in order for ArTara to file patent application(s) directed to patentable subject matter contained in the proposed Publication. If in its review, ArTara identifies information it considers to be its Confidential Information, ArTara may require redaction of that Confidential Information; provided, however, that ArTara shall not require removal of information necessary for complete and accurate presentation and interpretation of the Program Data and results. The Publication shall occur within one (1) month of the date the Project is closed or terminated, or University and/or Principal Investigator shall be free to publish Program Data and results at that time.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has blanks which make it hard to evaluate if there is a contradiction. The revised text shortens the review and objection periods for publications to 5 and 2 days respectively, which could be deemed unreasonably short for a thorough review. This timeline could create conflicts with academic freedom principles and potentially jeopardize the University's ability to publish research findings in a timely manner, potentially violating standard academic practices and federal research guidelines.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Academic freedom principles, potentially violating federal research guidelines related to publication and dissemination of research findings.
